page.title: 17SOCIAL CONCERNS BEULAH-GARTH
page.content: No real deprivation or poverty. Large % of Old Age Pensioners makes for low- income communities. On whole,community is caring, neighbours keep watch on old folk. Residents of O.A.P.bung- alows, Garth have warden care. W.R.V.S. Meals on Wheels delivered by van supplied by Powys C.C.,one day a week from Builth. Each old person able to purchase 2 meals (cost at present 50p) served by local volunteers who travel on the van. W.R.V.S.Social car scheme operates to help anyone with need of transport for visiting doctor or relatives in hospital. Panel of volunteer drivers with co-ordinators in Garth and Beulah. Pre-school Nursey Playgroup for children 3-4 years at Garth, average roll 12, drawn from school catchment area.
